Need Help With Building Permits in Los Angeles?

If you’re staring at LADBS or LA County permit pages wondering where to start, you’re not alone. Los Angeles splits building permits between LA City (LADBS) and LA County / EPIC-LA, and the rules change based on your address, project type, and valuation.

LA City vs LA County: Who Handles Your Permit?

Most properties inside the City of Los Angeles pull permits through the Los Angeles Department of Building and Safety (LADBS), which handles plan review, permits, inspections, and code enforcement. Homeowners can apply online for common projects such as re-roofs, panel upgrades, window replacements, and small interior remodels.

If your property is in an unincorporated area or certain contract cities, permits often go through LA County Public Works / Building & Safety using the EPIC-LA Permit Helper to figure out which office is in charge.

  • LADBS (City of LA): Roof, solar, ADU, additions, remodels inside city limits.
  • LA County / EPIC-LA: Many areas in the SGV, unincorporated pockets, and contract cities.

Common LA Permit Projects We See Every Week

In Los Angeles, the same projects come up over and over:

  • Re-roofs and roof replacements
  • Solar panel installs and service upgrades
  • Garage conversions and ADUs
  • Room additions and major remodels
  • HVAC changeouts and electrical panel upgrades

Each one has its own permit path, requirements, and inspection sequence. For busy contractors, keeping up with every change inside LADBS or the County portal is a full-time job by itself.
